The claim is contradicted by the expert: s verdict: The expert clearly states that the claim is false and provides evidence to support this conclusion.
Logical inconsistencies in the claim: The expert points out that the claim includes details that are impossible or highly unlikely, such as a dog going to the 112th floor of the damaged tower to rescue more victims. These inconsistencies raise doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Lack of verifiable sources: The expert mentions that the claim includes a reference to a New York Times article that supposedly supports the story, but no such article exists. This lack of verifiable sources undermines the credibility of the claim.
Lack of corroborating evidence: The expert does not find any other credible sources or evidence to support the claim. This absence of corroborating evidence further casts doubt on the authenticity of the claim.
